name: Croydon In The Mountains
description: Capture the true spirit of Jamaica by visiting the interior of the island for an exciting adventure. Journey into the majestic mountainous Jamaican countryside where lush vegetation, wild flowers and trickling waterfalls await you on your way to a pineapple and coffee plantation. This working plantation nestled in the foothills of the Catadupa Mountains provides breathtaking and panoramic views of the surrounding countryside and has won the coveted National Champion Plantation trophy. This is also the birthplace of Samuel Sharpe, one of Jamaica’s National heroes, who was instrumental in organizing the fight for the abolition of slavery, for which he paid the ultimate price, the loss of his life. Don’t miss this outing-of-a-lifetime and your chance to enjoy this manmade manicured marvel.
